With the run-up to the Coronation in full swing, the Princess of Wales isn’t the only Kate who has been impressing us in the style stakes this week.Kate Ferdinand wore an incredibly sophisticated black dress by Victoria Beckham, and now we’re fully obsessed with the scalloped trend.  Victoria Beckham Scalloped Semi-Sheer Knit Maxi Dress Is this the best black dress we’ve seen all year? It’s got to be up there! The knitted fabric means it will look just as good styled casually with trainers as with sky-high heels for the evening.  £850 Shop

She dressed to impress to watch her husband Rio being inducted into the Premier League Hall of Fame. The dress design is super simple, save for the scallop edging at the neckline and cuffs, which is enough of a curveball for us!The long sleeves are super sleek, and although it's not a maternity style, it shows off her baby bump perfectly.

Scalloping is never too far from the runway, with labels like Alaia, Prada, Valentino and Chloe making waves over the years. But this year, it’s Victoria Beckham and Saint Laurent leading the way.You can buy Kate’s knitted number for £850, but if you can’t justify splashing quite that much cash, the high street has come up trumps when it comes to this trend.

Do you fancy saving yourself just over £800 by shopping this very VB-esque dress at ASOS instead?
